author: Brickstarr
title: LETS GET THIS PARTY STARTED!!!
review:
Today I will be reviewing the LEGO collectible minifigure Birthday party boy (set 71021-16) he comes with 9 pieces and retails for £3 or $4.

Let me just say this is my favorite LEGO minifig in series 18. I just love how cool he looks and his hair looks a bit like mine, but now I'll get into the review...

His shorts are black then you see a bit of skin and also trainers. He has a blue and white spotted shirt and a blue and red striped tie. His face is kind and smiling and he has some cool green glasses. He has some cool spiked up blond hair and a light brown-dark blond hat on. He is holding a piece that looks like a LEGO minifig packet an orange balloon that is one piece and his present is red with blue wrapping and some red and white decoration on top.

Thanks for reading

I hope it was helpful :-)

author: Minifig290
title: Best of a Great Series
review:
Hello, Series 18 on the whole is a great series but the Party Boy is awesome let’s get into why

This figure is £2.99 or $3.99 giving him a 29p/39c price per part counting the baseplate, he is packed in a foil bag to surprise you when opening the packet.

Minifigure

The figure only uses 4 parts as usual but all the parts are so generic there useful, his hair price is a great new mild in a nice bright blond colour his face has a innocent young expression with a pair of green glasses.

His torso has a nice spotted print with a stripy orange and blue tie while his legs are duel moulded in a dark blue and yellow.

Accessories

Now what makes the figure for me is his awesome exclusive accessories, he has a new balloon piece that has a orange balloon and white ribbon which is similar to the party girls purple white balloon from this series.???????

Also he has a new for the series present piece in Red with a blue ribbon that continues onto the white lid inside the present are the best things ever two 1x1 printed series one minifigure packets that have 3 of the 16 figures the ninja, american woman and an other who i can’t remember :(.

Oh and a additional mention is for the orange minifigures baseplate which all 17 figures in the series have.

Overall

To conclude this review of a awesome figure i’d have to say go and buy one of these now before they get a silly high eBay price.

He has multiply great pieces and prints and hopefully the minifigure packet tiles are redone for other series in the future.

Pros- New and exclusive prints and moulds, two 1x1 printed minifigure packets, easy to acquire

Cons- None to mention

author: Odeinoichus
title: Meta Level Shenanigans.
review:
Set #71021 Birthday Party Boy: Our friendly looking child guest is sharing a release this Series with the Birthday Party Girl we've previously reviewed. Dressed in a festive polka dot top with pink and blue striped tie, this boy comes with a large boxed present and an orange balloon. Two printed tiles are included with him revealing some Meta Level fan service. This child is bringing LEGO Minifigures Series 1 to the party as a gift.

He has dual-molding for his arms and legs with a curled blonde hair piece and some nice glasses. Many US fans might liken him to a dressed up version of Dennis the Menace, only that character didn't wear glasses. Overall he's a solid offering from the Series and features some very nice parts. Now we just need a creepy looking clown Minifigure and the balloon in red.

Highly Recommended.
